etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Todd's Cyclopaedia of Anatomy and Physiology. Originally from scientific Latin Octopoda + -ous; in later use from octo- + -podous

definitions: Originally: of, relating to, or designating the order Octopoda of cephalopod molluscs, comprising the octopuses; = "octopod". Later (also): = "octopoid".
